<@U26PNJE4F|wbertan> has joined the channel

Hey everyone, I want to pass a full object across intents. I was going to just extend Serialisable but I was told it’s not advisable and I came across `Parcelable`. I’m curious what the right approach is, any ideas?
just use this: <http://www.parcelabler.com>
how big is the object?
Parcelable is optimised for Android but comes with some… ceremony
currently at 6 fields but it could grow to 15 ish. Basically, i’m only serialising 6 fields from an API at the moment but could serialise more later
yeah should be fine
problems arise when you try to pass giant serialised objects in activity bundles etc

<@U1JER4BDK>: Parcelable it's optimized in this case, serializable it's like let they try serialize the object, but with reflections this could be a doom, so with parcelable you explicit tell how to serialize your object, even with a little boilerplates this should be fast.

Just a suggestion if you pass via parcelable small object its fine if its going to be big object which have 10 to 20 rows of data then instead of loading them on create, load them in separate asynch task or any other alternative to it.
just to make the activity launch faster else you will find some delay in loading the activity..
So is there ever any case where serialisable is advisable? I’m asking because it sounds like I should always just start with Parcelable
If you are not allready using it; get the parcelable plugin for android studio
Ah I see guys, I think i'm going with Parcelable then :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks so much!

Hey guys Hope u  all are doing well.
I am using API level 23 can anyone suggest me , what to do if i want to check GPS is off then navigate to its settings in device.

<@U25CTHVN0> 

```LocationManager service = (LocationManager) getSystemService(LOCATION_SERVICE);
boolean enabled = service.isProviderEnabled(LocationManager.GPS_PROVIDER);

//Location not enabled. Navigate to settings
if(!enabled) {
    Intent intent = new Intent(Settings.ACTION_LOCATION_SOURCE_SETTINGS);
    startActivity(intent);
}```
<@U04U5KS3Z>  Thanks Alot for ur support :slightly_smiling_face: U saved my time #cheers

Hello, guys. I have the following bug: Binary XML file line #21: Error inflating class android.support.design.widget.FloatingActionButton. I have tried everything suggested on stackoverflow and nothing change the situation. I am extending from AppCompatActivity, using compile 'com.android.support:appcompat-v7:23.4.0’ and the parent in styles is Theme.AppCompat. I am using Android 5.0.1

```<android.support.design.widget.FloatingActionButton
        android:id="@+id/floating_btn"
        android:layout_width="wrap_content"
        android:layout_height="wrap_content"
        android:layout_alignParentBottom="true"
        android:layout_alignParentEnd="true"
        android:layout_alignParentRight="true"
        android:src="@drawable/plus"
        app:useCompatPadding="true"
        />```
i used this
compile 'com.getbase:floatingactionbutton:1.10.1'

`<com.getbase.floatingactionbutton.FloatingActionButton`
          ` android:id="@+id/action_b_left2"`
        `  android:layout_width="wrap_content"`
           `android:layout_height="wrap_content"`
           `fab:fab_colorNormal="#12af00"`
           `fab:fab_title="Populaire"`
           `fab:fab_colorPressed="#60ff52"`
           `fab:fab_icon="@mipmap/ticket"`
          ` />`
I will try, thank you :slightly_smiling_face:
you can use FloatingActionButton inside  FloatingActionMenu

attachments.title: Requesting Permissions at Run Time | Android Developers
attachments.text: Learn about runtime permissions and how they make it easier for users to install and upgrade your apps.
attachments.fallback: Requesting Permissions at Run Time | Android Developers

text: <#C055MSDCM|beginners> <---
Once a user grants permissions to an app the first time, does it always have it from there on out?
yes
sweet
unless the user revokes it
So it says `thisActivity` is the current activity
but does that mean permissions only apply to an individual view?
Im stupid. It just wants the `this` key word, doesnt it….
it just needs a context
you can do cmd+ P to check what is requested as method args

The permission request is for the app. So if you ask for the READ_CONTACTS permission and the user grants it to you, then you can use it anywhere in the app. However, if you use this permission in a few spots, you are going to have to check that this permission has been granted and perhaps ask for it.
Makes sense
Thx
FUCK YES!!!!
IT WORKS
Thanks guys! I really appreciate the help :smile:
Oh and as an FYI <@U055GGAHS> getResultData() does exactly what I want it to do :smile:
until some device adds more data to that intent or a future system change adds more to it

<@U21M14T8C> <http://Realm.io|Realm.io> or SQLite
and Parse
depends on business needs
by default I want <http://Realm.io|Realm.io> because I get to model the database with POJO
SQLite I use for legacy code
I use SQLite with GreenDAO for easy database schema management
